system_msg: You are a coastal scientist adept at labeling satellite images.
user_instruction: Classify this intermittently open estuary as `open`, `closed`, or `unsure`.
composite_hint: You are looking at false-color NIR satellite images of an estuary/ocean boundary. In these composites, vegetation is bright red, standing water is dark/black, sand is light/tan, and surf foam is bright white.

image_cues: Clouds, fog, heavy shadow, sensor streaks
Mouth area off-frame or missing pixels
Use **`unsure` ONLY** when **> 50 % of the berm/bridge throat is hidden by cloud, fog, deep shadow, sensor streaks, or the file is corrupted.**
**Blurry or low-resolution imagery is NOT enough**—if you can see most of the berm, pick the most likely of `open` or `closed` and justify briefly.

closed.definition: Berm (or culvert/road embankment at a bridge) blocks surface flow. Lagoon water (dark) and ocean are separated by ≥ 1 px of dry/damp light sand, and there is no aligned wet-sand corridor connecting the notch to the swash.
image_cues: Continuous light/tan sand ridge across the mouth with no gap
Dark lagoon water stops landward of the crest
Seaward side shows only normal beach wetness/foam not aligned with any notch
At bridges: no dark or wet-sand corridor reappears on the ocean side

open.definition: Berm is broken and there is a surface connection from lagoon to ocean, even if the channel is diffuse. Connection can be a visible dark ribbon or an aligned wet-sand corridor that reaches the swash zone. If a bridge is present, the corridor must reappear seaward and reach the swash.
image_cues: Unbroken dark channel lagoon → surf, or dark ribbon merging into bright-white breakers
Aligned wet-sand corridor from the notch to the swash (often darker/glossier and extending farther up-beach than surrounding wet sand)
At bridges: dark/wet corridor reappears seaward of the bridge and continues to the swash

bridge_rule.open_condition: Aligned dark or wet-sand corridor reappears seaward of the bridge and reaches the swash → open.
bridge_rule.closed_condition: Water disappears under the bridge and no aligned corridor is visible seaward → closed.
bridge_rule.unsure_condition: Bridge shadow/clouds hide both inlet and outlet so continuity cannot be judged → unsure.

decision_flow: 2. Is there a continuous sand/structure ridge with ≥1 px light sand separating lagoon and ocean AND no aligned wet-sand corridor? → closed
3. Otherwise (berm broken with a dark ribbon OR an aligned wet-sand corridor from notch to swash; at bridges it reappears seaward) → open
final_instructions: Review the example images provided and then label the last image.
If you label `unsure` incorrectly you will lose 2x more reward than mis-classifying `open` vs `closed`.
Return JSON with keys: label (unsure/closed/open) and reasoning (25-50 words explaining why your visual evidence matches the chosen class).
Only output `unsure` if the visibility rule above is met.
